official-title.#text:
Recognizing the 50th anniversary of the
		  landmark case Gideon v. Wainwright, in which the Supreme Court held that
		  counsel must be provided to indigent defendants in all felony
		  cases.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following
			 resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
recognizes and honors the 50th anniversary
			 of the decision in Gideon v. Wainwright;

encourages all people in the United States
			 to recognize and honor the 50th anniversary of the Gideon v. Wainwright
			 decision; and

supports
			 strategies to improve the criminal justice system to ensure that indigent
			 defendants in all felony cases are adequately represented by counsel.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
held in Argersinger v. Hamlin
			 that indigent defendants are entitled, under the 6th amendment to the United
			 States Constitution, to court-appointed counsel in all cases where imprisonment
			 is a possibility;

text.#text:
Whereas 50 years after the Gideon v. Wainwright decision,
			 excessive caseloads are preventing counsel for indigent defendants from
			 providing quality representation; and

Whereas the provision of counsel to indigent defendants
			 often lacks fairness and increases the risk that poor people will be wrongfully
			 convicted: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 108 IH: Recognizing the 50th anniversary of the landmark case Gideon v. Wainwright, in which the Supreme Court held that counsel must be provided to indigent defendants in all felony cases.
